channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Tanzania President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: DODOMA, Tanzania (AP) — Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced early Saturday, in a rare landslide victory in the region.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: New-look Dodgers lineup only produces 4 hits but they come at right time as LA forces Game 7
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A new-look lineup for the Los Angeles Dodgers only produced four hits in Game 6, but three of them came in a three-run rally off Blue Jays starter Kevin Gausman.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Heidi Klum reveals her much-anticipated 2025 Halloween costume
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Heidi Klum donned green scales and squirming snakes to transform herself into Medusa for Halloween on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Federal judge rules Trump can’t require citizenship proof on the federal voting form
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Donald Trump’s request to add a documentary proof of citizenship requirement to the federal voter registration form cannot be enforced, a federal judge ruled Friday. U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and NICHOLAS RICCARDI, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Supplements sold at Sam's Club nationwide linked to salmonella outbreak: FDA
item.description: Illnesses connected to using the product have been reported in Kansas, Florida, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, New York and Michigan. Three people who contracted salmonella were hospitalized, according to the CDC.
item.dc:creator: Kyler Swaim, NewsNation

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and other content from YouTube TV amid breakdown in talks
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Utah redistricting battle: Small city split into four congressional districts
item.description: The city's division means residents can cross different congressional districts simply by visiting nearby businesses.
item.dc:creator: Brian Entin, NewsNation

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: ICE officer shoots illegal immigrant during Phoenix traffic stop gone wrong, both hospitalized
item.description: ICE officer and Honduran man injured in Phoenix shooting during traffic stop. Jose Garcia-Sorto hospitalized in stable condition after Interstate 17 incident.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Missing 13-year-old Louisana girl found in Pittsburgh basement
item.description: During questioning, investigators learned he had been with the girl at the Greyhound Bus Station in Baton Rouge earlier that week.
item.dc:creator: Trinity Velazquez, NewsNation

item.title: Judge orders arrest of ex-Green Beret tied to failed Venezuela raid after court no-show
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — A federal judge in Tampa has ordered the arrest of a former Green Beret accused of plotting to invade Venezuela in 2020 after he failed to show up to court for a hearing on whether he should be taken back into custody for violating the conditions of his pre-trial release.
item.dc:creator: CURT ANDERSON and JOSHUA GOODMAN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: FBI confirms death, injury count in Michigan church shooting
item.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has confirmed the number of dead and injured in the shooting at an LDS church in Grand Blanc, Mich., in Sept.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Bittan, ABC 4

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution after admitting to gruesome murder
item.description: South Carolina death row inmate Stephen Bryant chooses firing squad execution for Nov. 14, becoming the third this year to select the method.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Judge orders Trump administration to pay SNAP benefits with emergency funds
item.description: U.S. District Judge John McConnell’s order prevents the administration from completely drying up the benefit for more than 40 million Americans.
item.dc:creator: Zach Schonfeld, NewsNation

item.title: Virginia teacher shot by 6-year-old student 'thought she was dead' as bodycam emerges
item.description: Virginia teacher Abby Zwerner testifies about being shot by 6-year-old student, telling court, 'I thought I was dead' as police footage reveals chaotic aftermath.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Alabama man charged with threatening rabbis, imam and others in multiple Southern states
item.description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Federal prosecutors have charged an Alabama man with making threatening calls and texts to multiple rabbis, an imam and others in the South, including telling one rabbi that “I want you to die.
item.dc:creator: KIM CHANDLER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Virginia Senate approves Democrat-led redistricting amendment
item.description: The party has to pass the amendment in the state legislature one more time before it can be teed up before the public for a vote.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Vakil, NewsNation

item.title: Nation’s largest airlines press Democrats to pass funding stopgap to reopen government
item.description: Four of the nation’s largest airlines are pressing Senate Democrats to pass a clean stopgap spending bill to reopen the government amidst growing delays at airports around the country caused by staffing issues linked to the expiration of government funding a month ago.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, NewsNation

item.title: Escaped monkeys from Mississippi truck crash puts spotlight on NIH-funded Tulane lab
item.description: Three monkeys remain at large after truck crash in Mississippi released 21 primates from Tulane University research program allegedly funded by NIH, sparking public safety concerns.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: California animal shelter rescues nearly 100 small pets from single home
item.description: The organization took in 31 mice and 63 hamsters, some of which are pregnant and expected to give birth soon.
item.dc:creator: Lily Dallow, NewsNation

item.title: Wisconsin judge puts on hold ruling that required citizenship check of voters
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A Wisconsin judge on Friday put on hold his order that requires elections officials to verify the citizenship of all 3.6 million registered voters in the battleground state before the next statewide election in February.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Black vultures attack and kill cattle. Climate change is one reason they're spreading north
item.description: EMINENCE, Ky. (AP) — Allan Bryant scans the sky as he watches over a minutes-old calf huddled under a tree line with its mother. After a few failed tries, the calf stands on wobbly legs for the first time, looking to nurse. Above, a pair of birds circle in the distance.
item.dc:creator: JOSHUA A. BICKEL and MELINA WALLING, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: With fragile Gaza ceasefire holding, Trump wants to make headway on Indonesia-Israel normalization
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump made sure during his visit to Asia this week to praise regional allies who have backed his push to bring about a permanent end to the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: AAMER MADHANI and EDNA TARIGAN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Photos: Trumps host Halloween event at White House
item.description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted trick-or-treaters on Thursday in a Halloween celebration that has become a fun White House tradition.
item.dc:creator: The Hill, Fox 5

item.title: Why some schools have been spooked out of Halloween
item.description: Religion, politics and student participation are all among the reasons some schools have abandoned Halloween celebrations that put candy-filled children in bulky costumes in classrooms.
item.dc:creator: Lexi Lonas Cochran, WFLA, NBC

item.title: A solid gold toilet is up for auction with a $10 million starting price
item.description: LONDON (AP) — For sale: The world’s most valuable toilet, a lavatory literally worth its weight in gold. Sotheby’s announced Friday that it will auction off the solid gold cistern, a sculpture by Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan entitled “America.
item.dc:creator: JILL LAWLESS Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Controversy over Tucker Carlson interview reveals conservative movement's conflict over antisemitism
item.description: The president of a Republican-aligned think tank has defended Tucker Carlson after the conservative media personality offered a platform to a far-right activist known for pushing white nationalist and antisemitic views.
item.dc:creator: Matt Brown, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Utah man accused of throwing 6 puppies out of car on highway, killing 2 of them
item.description: Memphis Lor, 25, was arrested on seven counts of torturing a companion animal, a third-degree felony. He has not been formally charged.
item.dc:creator: Sorina Trauntvein, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: See it: NYC streets submerged as torrential rain hits the city
item.description: NEW YORK (PIX11) -- Heavy rain has hit New York City, causing significant flooding across the boroughs. The National Weather Service issued a flood warning for Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and the Bronx on Thursday afternoon through 5:30 p.m.
item.dc:creator: Video credit: Eileen Lehpamer, NewsNation

item.title: Parents of Nashville school shooting victims fight to keep records out of public view
item.description: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) — The parents of children killed in a shooting at a private Christian school in Nashville are fighting to keep police investigative records a secret, even after many documents were leaked to a conservative media outlet.
item.dc:creator: TRAVIS LOLLER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: NASA takes one step closer to launching quiet supersonic jets
item.description: A supersonic jet plane designed to make very little noise took flight for the first time this week, cruising over the southern California desert just after sunrise in what could be the first step toward much faster commercial travel, according to NASA. NASA and the U.S.
item.dc:creator: SAFIYAH RIDDLE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs seeks speedy appeals court hearing while he serves a 4-year sentence
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Hip-hop producer Sean “Diddy” Combs wants a federal appeals court to quickly consider the legality of his conviction on prostitution-related charges and his more than four-year prison sentence. His lawyers filed papers with the 2nd U.S.
item.dc:creator: LARRY NEUMEISTER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Patients go without needed treatment after the government shutdown disrupts a telehealth program
item.description: MINOOKA, Ill. (AP) — Bill Swick has a rare degenerative brain disease that inhibits his mobility and speech. Instead of the hassle of traveling an hour to a clinic in downtown Chicago to visit a speech therapist, he has benefited from virtual appointments from the comfort of his home.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and OBED LAMY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Where the jewels stolen from the Louvre Museum might end up
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Seven people have been arrested in the investigation of a stunning heist at the Louvre Museum in Paris, but the lavish, stolen jewels that once adorned France's royals are still missing.
item.dc:creator: WYATTE GRANTHAM-PHILIPS and R.J. RICO, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: How Americans will be celebrating Halloween, according to a new AP-NORC poll
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Sherry Jenkins is a Halloween person by default. She lives in Blairstown, New Jersey, a rural town where much of the original “Friday the 13th” horror movie was filmed.
item.dc:creator: LEANNE ITALIE and LINLEY SANDERS, Associated Press, ABC 4
